meanings.definition: Make sensitive or aware to a particular stimulus or situation.
meanings.sent1: The training will sensitize employees to the importance of safety procedures.
meanings.sent2: The workshop aims to sensitize participants to the needs of the community.
meanings.sent3: The movie sensitize the audience to the effects of climate change in a creative way.
meanings.sent4: Her story sensitize me to the struggles faced by many people around the world.
meanings.sent5: The powerful documentary sensitize viewers to the harsh realities of poverty.

meanings.definition: Cause to respond to certain stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The medication may sensitize the skin to sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Repeated exposure can sensitize the body to allergens.
meanings.sent3: The experiment sensitize the rats to the sound of a bell for a funny reason.
meanings.sent4: His experience sensitize him to the dangers of reckless driving in a surprising way.
meanings.sent5: The intense training sensitize athletes to perform at their best under pressure.
